name: MS Paint Bird
notes: I actually started this piece drawing a secretary bird but then Frankenstein'd it into a pigeon without using a reference. (Hopefully you can't tell.) It's intentionally a bit rough around the edges.

name: Portrait of Alan Turing
notes: For this piece, I challenged myself to use only one color and one type of brush. I think I did well at bringing out distinctive details despite the constraints. I still remember laughing to my friends about how ridiculously simple Turing's hair is to draw in the school library.

name: Large Pink Flower
notes: This drawing is actually a high school art class assignment, but I'm still pretty fond of it. I used my photography as a reference. Also, the teacher almost failed me because I took so long, but thankfully she bumped me up to an A after I showed her the finished piece.

name: Small Pink Flower
notes: I felt upset over this drawing at first but grew to like it later. Creating a good dark-light contrast took a while, but I think I ultimately did well.

name: Portrait of a Woman
notes: My rendition of Da Vinci's La Scapigliata. I drew this in only a few days, pleasantly surprising even myself.

name: Pigeon and Olive Branch
notes: The bird in this drawing is an Oriental Frill pigeon. I tried to vary the color usage more, but I'm not sure how well it really worked. Drawing the olive branch over the spray paint background was probably my favorite part.
